No build processes are running right now—`ps aux | grep -i build` comes up empty, so nothing is building in this workspace. If you just started one, it either exited already or never launched. I’d relaunch your build (e.g. the usual `poetry build`/`npm run build`) and keep an eye on the terminal output, or point me to any specific log file you want inspected.

_**User (2025-11-03 07:13-0800)**_

Does ChromaDB run in memory?

---

_**Agent (model gpt-5-codex, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Reviewing ChromaDB persistence defaults**</details></think>

---

By default ChromaDB runs in-memory—client data sits in an embedded DuckDB that’s not persisted unless you point it at a `persist_directory`. If you supply a directory or set `persist_directory` after creation and call `persist()`, it switches to disk-backed storage and survives restarts.

---
